  "article_text": [
    "the full flag variety @xmath2 consists of the set of all flags in @xmath3 , @xmath4 the integral cohomology ring @xmath5 can be explicitly described as a quotient of the graded polynomial ring @xmath6 $ ] with @xmath7 .",
    "write @xmath8 for the @xmath9th elementary symmetric function in @xmath10 variables .",
    "denote by @xmath11^{s_n}=\\z[\\varepsilon_1,\\varepsilon_2 , \\dots , \\varepsilon_n]$ ] the ring of symmetric functions , and let @xmath12 be the two - sided ideal of @xmath13 generated by the elementary symmetric functions with no constant term .",
    "the cohomology ring of @xmath2 is the quotient @xmath14/ { \\lambda}_n^+.\\ ] ]    let @xmath15 be a partition of @xmath10 , and let @xmath16 be its transpose partition . consider a nilpotent matrix @xmath17 of jordan type @xmath18 .",
    "the springer variety @xmath19 is the closed subvariety of @xmath2 consisting of those flags preserved by @xmath17 @xmath20 work of de concini and procesi  @xcite and tanisaki  @xcite generalizes the above characterization of @xmath21 showing that the integral cohomology ring of the springer variety @xmath22 is isomorphic to the quotient of the polynomial ring @xmath13 by the two - sided ideal @xmath23 generated by the following elements : @xmath24 where @xmath25 denotes the @xmath9th elementary symmetric function in the variables of @xmath26 and @xmath27 for more details on the cohomology of springer varieties see  @xcite , and for a generalization of this ideal see @xcite",
    ".    the cohomology rings of springer varieties carry additional structure summarized below .    1 .",
    "there is an action of the symmetric group @xmath28 on @xmath29 that preserves the cohomological grading .",
    "the pull - back homomorphism @xmath30 arising from the inclusion @xmath31 is a surjective @xmath32-module map .",
    "the top nonzero degree of rational cohomology @xmath33 is isomorphic to the irreducible @xmath34-module corresponding to the partition @xmath18 .",
    "the full rational cohomology @xmath35 is isomorphic as a @xmath34-module to the permutation module @xmath36 .    from the polynomial presentation of the cohomology ring of the full flag variety in the action of the symmetric group",
    "is quite transparent ( springer s original action is more sophisticated  @xcite ) .",
    "in particular , @xmath37 acts on @xmath38 by permuting indices so that @xmath39 since this action of @xmath28 preserves the ideal of symmetric functions @xmath12 , it descends to an action on the quotient @xmath21 .",
    "the ideal @xmath23 is preserved by the action of @xmath28 , so there is also a natural @xmath28-action on the quotient @xmath40 .",
    "the rings @xmath29 inherit the grading from @xmath13 . since the ideal @xmath23 is homogeneous , the action of @xmath28 restricts to an action on each graded piece of @xmath29",
    ".    recent work of ellis and khovanov introduces a new  odd \" analog of the hopf algebra of symmetric functions  @xcite .",
    "the ring of odd symmetric functions , denoted by @xmath41 , is noncommutative despite exhibiting behaviour surprisingly similar to the ordinary ring of symmetric functions ; it has odd analogs of elementary , complete , and schur function bases .",
    "the ring @xmath41 is a certain quotient of a related version of noncommutative symmetric functions defined by thibon and ung  @xcite .",
    "the precise form of this quotient is essential to the results in this article .",
    "the odd symmetric function and ordinary symmetric function rings have the same graded rank and become isomorphic when coefficients are reduced modulo two .",
    "these quintessential rank and reduction features characterize the  oddification \" of an algebraic object .",
    "recent work of the first author with ellis and khovanov gives an explicit realization of odd symmetric functions in the ring of skew polynomials @xmath42 and uses this to connect odd symmetric functions to a new odd analog of the nilhecke algebra  @xcite inspired by constructions in heegaard - floer homology  @xcite .",
    "kang , kashiwara , and tsuchioka  @xcite independently studied the odd nilhecke algebra in their work on categorification of hecke - clifford super algebras , and it is closely related to earlier work of wang  @xcite .",
    "this algebra also appears in recent work of hill and wang on categorifications of quantum kac - moody superalgebras  @xcite .",
    "the parallels between the odd and even nilhecke algebras extend further .",
    "just as cyclotomic quotients of the nilhecke algebra are morita equivalent to the integral cohomology rings @xmath43 of grassmannians of @xmath44-planes in @xmath45  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* section 5 ) , the corresponding cyclotomic quotients of the odd nilhecke algebra are morita equivalent to _ noncommutative _ rings @xmath46  @xcite .",
    "the graded ranks of these rings are the same , they become isomorphic when coefficients are reduced modulo two , and @xmath46 has a basis consisting of certain odd schur polynomials  @xcite .",
    "in other words , @xmath46 is an oddification of the cohomology of the grassmannian .    the nilhecke algebra , cohomology rings of grassmannians , and the ring of symmetric functions are vital components in the theory of categorified quantum @xmath47  @xcite , which underlies khovanov homology . all of the odd structures discussed above aim to establish a similar algebraic framework underlying the odd khovanov homology theory of ozsvth , rasmussen , szab  @xcite .",
    "these invariants , which both categorify the jones polynomial , are distinct ( see  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* section 3.1 ) ) but agree modulo two .    another algebraic structure closely connected to khovanov homology is the springer variety @xmath48 .",
    "in particular , the cohomology of @xmath48 is isomorphic to the center of khovanov s arc algebra @xmath49 used in one construction of khovanov homology for tangles  @xcite .",
    "there is a generalization of khovanov s arc algebra  @xcite that stroppel and webster showed is isomorphic to the convolution algebra formed on cohomologies of components of the springer variety  @xcite .",
    "these springer varietes also arise in cautis - kamnitzer s geometric construction of khovanov homology using derived categories coherent sheaves  @xcite .",
    "these connections lead one to ask whether the cohomology of springer varieties also have natural  odd \" analogs . in this article",
    "we introduce graded quotient modules over the skew polynomial ring which are oddifications of the cohomology of springer varieties @xmath19 for any partition .    in the odd",
    "setting there is an action of the symmetric group @xmath28 on @xmath50 .",
    "however , odd symmetric functions are not preserved by this action .",
    "this raises the question of what object plays the role of the symmetric group @xmath28 in the odd theory of springer varieties .",
    "here we show that the hecke algebra @xmath51 at @xmath0 is the natural analog .",
    "we begin by defining an action of the hecke algebra @xmath51 at @xmath0 on the space of skew polynomials @xmath50 .",
    "a related action of @xmath51 on @xmath13 was defined in @xcite where @xmath52 acts by the q - commutator @xmath53_q=\\partial_i x_i - q x_i \\partial_i,\\ ] ] and @xmath54 is the divided difference operator ( see section  [ subsec_hecke ] ) .",
    "when @xmath55 the q - commutator action is just the usual permutation action of @xmath56 $ ] on @xmath13 . in (",
    "* claim 3.1 ) it is shown that the ring of symmetric functions @xmath57 can also be understood as the space of invariants in @xmath13 under this action of @xmath51 .",
    "the odd nilhecke algebra acts on skew polynomials by so - called odd divided difference operators . using these operators",
    "we define an action of @xmath51 at @xmath0 by a similar @xmath58-commutator formula and prove the following theorem .",
    "odd symmetric functions @xmath59 are precisely the skew - polynomials in @xmath50 that are invariant under the action of @xmath60 .",
    "in other words , @xmath61 for all generators @xmath52 in @xmath60 if and only if @xmath62 is odd symmetric .    just as commutativity",
    "is lost in the passage from cohomology rings of grassmanians to odd cohomology of grassmanians , the odd cohomology of springer varieties no longer possess a commutative ring structure or even a ring structure at all .",
    "this occurs because the left ideal @xmath63 generated by the elements in @xmath64 differs from the right ideal @xmath65 .",
    "this fact was first observed by alexander ellis .",
    "thus , the definition of the odd cohomology of the full flag variety requires a choice of the left or right ideal . quotienting by the two - sided ideal leads to torsion in the quotient ring , and the resulting ring will not have the same dimension as the ordinary cohomology ring @xmath21 when coefficients are reduced modulo two .",
    "the action of @xmath60 on @xmath50 is homogeneous with the respect to the grading .",
    "since the left ideal @xmath66 is preserved by the action of @xmath60 and is generated by homogenous elements , the quotient module @xmath67 is a left graded @xmath60-module .",
    "we denote this quotient by @xmath68 since it will play the role of the cohomology of the full flag variety in the odd theory .    taking the analogy between the even and odd theories one step further",
    ", we construct odd analogs @xmath69 of the ideals @xmath23 from and show that these are also invariant under the hecke algebra @xmath60 action .",
    "this allows us to define graded left @xmath60-modules @xmath70 the ring @xmath50 is graded with @xmath71 , and the ideal @xmath69 is homogeneous with respect to this grading , so that the action of @xmath60 restricts to an action on each homogeneous component of @xmath72 . in this article",
    "we prove the following results .    1 .",
    "there is an isomorphism of graded vector spaces : @xmath73 2 .",
    "the underlying abelian group of @xmath72 is a free graded @xmath74-module that admits an integral basis identical in form to the garsia - procesi basis  @xcite of @xmath29 .",
    "using this basis we show that the graded ranks agree @xmath75 3 .",
    "there is a surjective homomorphism @xmath76 of graded @xmath60-modules .",
    "working over a field @xmath77 , the top graded component @xmath78 of @xmath72 is isomorphic as an @xmath60-module to the specht module @xmath79 .",
    "though we utilize many of the combinatorial techniques introduced by tanisaki  @xcite and by garsia and procesi  @xcite , we emphasize that the identification of @xmath78 with the specht module requires new methods .",
    "this phenomenon is genuinely `` odd '' in that arguments make extensive use of calculations in the odd nilhecke algebra .",
    "the original identification of the specht module with the top degree cohomology of the springer variety @xmath19 uses results from geometry .",
    "since the precise connection between the odd theory and geometry has yet to be developed , we must prove directly that the top cohomology of odd springer varieties is isomorphic to the specht module of the hecke algebra @xmath60 .",
    "this requires an explicit verification of row relations and garnir relations ( propositions  [ prop_row ] and [ prop_garnir ] ) .",
    "* acknowledgments : * this project arose out of a general program started by the first author with alexander ellis and mikhail khovanov to identify odd analogs of representation theoretic objects .",
    "the idea of looking for odd analogs of cohomology of springer fibers arose from these conversations .",
    "both authors are grateful to monica vazirani and alexander kleshchev for helpful discussions on the representation theory of hecke algebras , and to sabin cautis and anthony licata for helpful discussions on springer varieties .",
    "the first author was partially supported by the nsf grant dms-0855713 , and the alfred p. sloan foundation .",
    "we would also like to acknowledge the use of the nc - algebra mathematica package for calculations related to this project .",

    "see @xcite and the references therein for a related version of noncommutative symmetric functions .",
    "odd symmetric functions also have natural bases corresponding to complete , monomial , and forgotten symmetric functions , as well as a schur polynomials basis  @xcite .",
    "there is also an odd analog of the littlewood - richardson rule for schur polynomials developed by ellis  @xcite .",

    "* section 2 ) .    given a partition @xmath249",
    "the height @xmath250 of @xmath18 is the number of nonzero elements of the partition .",
    "if @xmath18 is visualized as a top and left justified young diagram , the height @xmath250 is the number of rows . for @xmath251 and @xmath252 a node @xmath253 of a young diagram",
    "is the box in row @xmath201 and column @xmath254 .    for @xmath255 , define @xmath256 to be the partition of @xmath257 obtained from @xmath18 by doing the following .",
    "* remove the rightmost box in the @xmath258 row of @xmath18 . *",
    "if the resulting shape is top and left justified do nothing . *",
    "if removing a box creates a broken column , shift all boxes below the gap directly upwards .",
    "the resulting shape is now top and left justified .    using the subpartitions @xmath256 define the set @xmath248 for @xmath72 recursively by @xmath259",

    "the following proof closely follows that of garsia - procesi  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* proposition 2.1 ) ( see also @xcite ) but details are included for the reader s convenience .",
    "the set @xmath248 spans @xmath72 .",
    "we prove this result via induction on the size of @xmath18 . for the base case , observe that @xmath279",
    ". therefore @xmath280 clearly spans @xmath281 .",

    "since both of the sets @xmath320 and @xmath248 consist of identical monomials with unit coefficients , it follows that they give a basis for the @xmath321-vector spaces @xmath322 and @xmath323 , respectively .",

    "we now introduce a technique for determining if a monomial multiplied by an elementary symmetric function is in the ideal @xmath69 .",
    "it follows from that for @xmath327 and @xmath328 @xmath329 this equation _ promotes _ the degree of elementary symmetric functions from @xmath9 to @xmath330 .",
    "observe that , starting with @xmath331 , we can promote a second time by applying to the term @xmath332 .",
    "more generally , define the _ maximal promotion _ of @xmath333 to be the result of iteratively applying .",
    "start by skew - commuting @xmath334 to the right of the other variables and promoting wherever possible until all powers of @xmath334 have been exhausted .",
    "the unused powers of @xmath334 are then skew commuted back to the front .",
    "repeat this process with the variable @xmath335 , skew - commuting the unused variables back to their original location when finished maximally promoting .",
    "continue until all variables appearing before @xmath336 have been maximally promoted . as an example",
    ", the maximal promotion of @xmath337 is @xmath338    it is not too difficult to derive an explicit formula for maximal promotion .",
    "however , we will not need such formulas in what follows .",
    "it suffices to know that the maximal promotion results in a sum of terms of the form @xmath339 where @xmath340 , @xmath341 , and @xmath342 is a subset of @xmath343 satisfying the condition that a variable @xmath344 only if @xmath345 .    for an analysis of",
    "whether or not @xmath346 is in the ideal @xmath69 for some monomial @xmath62 , it suffices to check @xmath347 only for the minimal possible value of @xmath348 corresponding to each variable set @xmath349 arising in the maximal promotion .",
    "below we illustrate how maximal promotion can be used to identify elements in @xmath69 .",

    "this bijection is extended to a bijection between all row standard tableau and monomials of shape @xmath18 in @xcite .",

    "a.  mbirika . a hessenberg generalization of the garsia - procesi basis for the cohomology ring of springer varieties .",
    ", 17(1):research paper 153 , 29 , 2010 .",
    "http://arxiv.org/abs/0911.4962[arxiv:0911.4962 ] .",
    "skew shape representations are irreducible . in _ combinatorial and geometric representation theory ( seoul , 2001 )",
    "_ , volume 325 of _ contemp .",
    "_ , pages 161189 .",
    "soc . , providence , ri , 2003 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we identify the ring of odd symmetric functions introduced by ellis and khovanov as the space of skew polynomials fixed by a natural action of the hecke algebra at @xmath0 . </S>",
    "<S> this allows us to define graded modules over the hecke algebra at @xmath0 that are ` odd ' analogs of the cohomology of type @xmath1 springer varieties . </S>",
    "<S> the graded module associated to the full flag variety corresponds to the quotient of the skew polynomial ring by the left ideal of nonconstant odd symmetric functions . </S>",
    "<S> the top degree component of the odd cohomology of springer varieties is identified with the corresponding specht module of the hecke algebra at @xmath0 . </S>"
  ]
}
